data.name: Public Companies
data.text: Public companies are businesses that sell shares of stock to the public. They operate under regulations set by the securities exchange commission. By investing in public companies, you can become a partial owner and potentially earn profits through dividends and stock price appreciation.

data.name: How Public Companies Operate
data.text: Public companies have a board of directors who make important decisions and appoint the management team. They are required to disclose financial information to the public regularly. Shareholders can vote on key matters during annual general meetings.
